Description: Fragment of East Greek pottery plate or standed bowl (Protomenteller); plain upturned rim; cream slip inside and out; band and line at edge of floor, part of floral and ray frieze with some added red; pendent triangle as filling ornament. Three bands at top of outside wall, two more at lower break.
Curator's comments: The outward-pointing rays are atypical for South Ionian production, and together with the thick slip and darkish clay suggest a Hellespontine origin.
Bibliographic references: Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. VII, no. 10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.908)
